Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.Marble

Class MarbleMarket

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Marble.MarbleMarket
public class MarbleMarket
extends java.lang.Object
this class represents the market of marbles

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    MarbleMarket()
    this is the constructor of the class, in particular, it create a casual market calling the method setCasualMatrix

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int getColumnDimension()
    this method get the column dimension of the matrix
    Marble getLonelyMarble()
    this method get the lonely marble
    Marble getMarble​(int row, int column)
    this method get the marble from the matrix at the position selected
    Marble[][] getMarketTray()
    this method get the marble matrix
    int getRowDimension()
    this method get the row dimension of the matrix
    java.util.List<Marble> selectColumn​(int column)
    this method get a column of resources from market and shifts up the marbles of one position, when the first position is filled by the lonely marble, and the lonely marble position is filled by the marble at the last position
    java.util.List<Marble> selectRow​(int row)
    this method get a row of resources from market and shifts left the marbles of one position, when the first position is filled by the lonely marble, and the lonely marble position is filled by the marble at the last position
    void setCasualMatrix()
    this method create and shuffle all the marbles of the matrix, in particular it creates a random lookup table and for each marble assign a random position
    java.lang.String toString()  

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • MarbleMarket

      public MarbleMarket()
      this is the constructor of the class, in particular, it create a casual market calling the method setCasualMatrix

  • Method Details

    • setCasualMatrix

      public void setCasualMatrix()
      this method create and shuffle all the marbles of the matrix, in particular it creates a random lookup table and for each marble assign a random position

    • selectColumn

      public java.util.List<Marble> selectColumn​(int column)
      this method get a column of resources from market and shifts up the marbles of one position, when the first position is filled by the lonely marble, and the lonely marble position is filled by the marble at the last position
      Parameters:
      column - this is the column chosen to get and shift
      Returns:
      all the marbles contained in the selected column, null if the input is not between 0 and 3

    • selectRow

      public java.util.List<Marble> selectRow​(int row)
      this method get a row of resources from market and shifts left the marbles of one position, when the first position is filled by the lonely marble, and the lonely marble position is filled by the marble at the last position
      Parameters:
      row - this is the row chosen to get and shift
      Returns:
      all the marbles contained in the selected row, null if the input is not between 0 and 3

    • getColumnDimension

      public int getColumnDimension()
      this method get the column dimension of the matrix
      Returns:
      the column dimension of the matrix

    • getRowDimension

      public int getRowDimension()
      this method get the row dimension of the matrix
      Returns:
      the row dimension of the matrix

    • getLonelyMarble

      public Marble getLonelyMarble()
      this method get the lonely marble
      Returns:
      the lonely marble

    • getMarketTray

      public Marble[][] getMarketTray()
      this method get the marble matrix
      Returns:
      the marble matrix

    • getMarble

      public Marble getMarble​(int row, int column)
      this method get the marble from the matrix at the position selected
      Parameters:
      row - this is the row selected
      column - this is the column selected
      Returns:
      the marble from the matrix at the row and column selected
